SENSEI.Definition: a teacher or instructor usually of Japanese martial arts (such as karate or judo)

ALIKE.Definition: used after referring to two groups of people or things to show that both groups are included

PRODUCTIVE.Definition: causing or providing a good result or a large amount of something

ENJOYABLE.Definition: an enjoyable event or experience gives you pleasure

EXPENDING.Definition: to use or spend time, effort, or money

DETERMINE.Definition: to control or influence something directly, or to decide what will happen

MOTIVATES.Definition: to make someone want to do something well

QUALIFY.Definition: to successfully finish a training course so that you are able to do a job; to have or achieve the necessary skills, etc.

EXCHANGE PROGRAM.Definition: an arrangement in which people from different countries visit each other's country, perhaps to strengthen links between them or to improve foreign language skills

VOCABULARY.Definition: all the words known and used by a particular person

PSYCHOLOGICAL.Definition: relating to the human mind and feelings

ANXIETY.Definition: something that causes a feeling of fear and worry

INVOLVED.Definition: to include someone in something, or to make them take part in or feel part of it

ACADEMIC.Definition: relating to schools, colleges, and universities, or connected with studying and thinking, not with practical skills

VOLUNTEER.Definition: to offer to do something that you do not have to do, often without having been asked to do it and/or without expecting payment

STRUGGLE.Definition: to experience difficulty and make a very great effort in order to do something

WILLING.Definition: to be happy to do something if it is needed

AVAILABILITY.Definition: the fact that you have time free for doing something, or the amount of time that you have

LITERALLY.Definition: used to emphasize what you are saying

METHODOLOGY.Definition: a system of ways of doing, teaching, or studying something

PERSONALITY.Definition: the type of person you are, shown by the way you behave, feel, and think

ACCENT.Definition: the way in which people in a particular area, country, or social group pronounce words

PRESENCE.Definition: a quality that makes people notice or admire you, even when you are not speaking

SENSE OF HUMOR.Definition: your ability to understand funny things

FACTOR.Definition: one of several things that affects or influences a situation

STRATEGY.Definition: a way of doing something or dealing with something

BE A RECIPE FOR DISASTER.Definition: to be very likely to become a disaster, success, etc.

SPECIALIZES.Definition: to study or work on a particular subject or skill more than any others, so that you become an expert in it

CALMING.Definition: peaceful, quiet, or relaxed; without hurried movement, anxiety, or noise

ASSUME.Definition: to accept that something is true without being sure about it

PRETENDING.Definition: to behave as if something is true when you know that it is not, especially in order to deceive people or as a game

RUIN.Definition: to spoil something severely or destroy it

POINT.Definition: an opinion or fact that deserves to be considered seriously, or that other people agree is true

DICTIONARY.Definition: a book that contains a list of words in alphabetical order and explains their meanings, or gives a word for them in another language; an electronic product giving similar information on a computer, smartphone, etc.

Y'ALL.Definition: used to address a group of people that you are speaking to

GUILTY.Definition: if you feel guilty, you feel that you have done something wrong

TRANSLATE.Definition: to change words into a different language

INTERNALIZE.Definition: to accept an idea, attitude, belief, etc., so that it becomes part of your character

PAINFULLY.Definition: used to emphasize a quality, action, or situation that is unpleasant or not wanted

RAPIDLY.Definition: in a fast or sudden way

CONSUMING.Definition: to watch or read forms of media (= the internet, television, newspapers, magazines, etc.) or take in information from these

DOUBTS.Definition: (a feeling of) not being certain about something, especially about how good or true it is

CLEARED UP.Definition: to give or find an explanation for something, or to deal with a problem or argument

LEAGUE.Definition: a group of teams playing a sport who take part in competitions between each other

CONSISTENTLY.Definition: in a way that does not change

IDENTIFIED.Definition: to recognize someone or something and say or prove who or what that person or thing is

SPONSOR.Definition: a person or an organization that pays for or plans and carries out a project or activity

EMPHASIZE.Definition: to state or show that something is especially important or deserves special attention

HIT ME UP.Definition: to ask (someone) for something (such as money)

JUMPING IN.Definition: to suddenly become involved in a situation or discussion

RESCUE.Definition: to help someone or something out of a dangerous, harmful, or unpleasant situation

FORMAL.Definition: formal language, clothes, and behavior are suitable for serious or official occasions

COUNTLESS.Definition: very many, or too many to be counted

IELTS.Definition: abbreviation for International English Language Testing System: a test in the ability to use the English language for people from other countries who need a qualification to study at a university or to work in Australia, Canada, Ireland, South Africa, New Zealand, or the U.K.

WEIRD.Definition: very strange and unusual, unexpected, or not natural

POP CULTURE.Definition: music, TV, movies, books, etc. that are popular and enjoyed by ordinary people, rather than experts or very educated people

END UP.Definition: to reach a particular place or achieve a situation after other activities

REALIZING.Definition: to become aware of or understand a situation

ASS.Definition: used as a postpositive intensive especially with words of derogatory implication

ABNORMALLY.Definition: in a way that is abnormal (= different from what is usual or average)

BABY TALK.Definition: the words that a very young child uses, or the words used by adults when they talk to babies

TAKE WHAT I'M SAYING WITH A GRAIN OF SAL.Definition: to not completely believe something that you are told, because you think it is unlikely to be true

COME TO MIND.Definition: to be remembered or thought of

REFLECT.Definition: to think carefully, especially about possibilities and opinions

PERSPECTIVE.Definition: a particular way of considering something

DM.Definition: abbreviation for direct message: a private message sent on a social media website, that only the person it is sent to can see

INVEST.Definition: to put money, effort, time, etc. into something to make a profit or get an advantage

DEDICATED.Definition: believing that something is very important and giving a lot of time and energy to it

MENTOR.Definition: a person who gives a younger or less experienced person help and advice over a period of time, especially at work or school
